text: IRL – Online Life is Real Life (also known as IRL for short) is a podcast by Firefox. The podcast discusses how activity on the internet affects society as a whole, such as privacy and security. The first episode aired on June 26, 2017, titled All Your Data Are Belong to Us. Each season lasts 7 episodes long, with some seasons including bonus episodes. It was hosted by Veronica Belmont from season 1 to season 3, then hosted by Manoush Zomorodi for season 4 and 5. On August 10, 2017, Veronica Belmont announced that the podcast had reached 500,000 downloads. On November 8, 2017, Dan Misener wrote that the podcast had reached 1 million downloads by the end of the first season. In 2018, the podcast won a Webby Award for "Best Branded Podcast or Segment" in the category "Podcasts & Digital Audio Features". == Episodes == === Season 1 === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- !# !Title !Length (minutes:seconds) !Original release date |} ==== Bonus episodes ==== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- !# !Title !Length (minutes:seconds) !Original release date |} === Season 2 === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- !# !Title !Length (minutes:seconds) !Original release date |} === Season 3 === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- !# !Title !Length (minutes:seconds) !Original release date |} === Season 4 === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- !# !Title !Length (minutes:seconds) !Original release date |} === Season 5 === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- !# !Title !Length (minutes:seconds) !Original release date |} == References == Category:Mozilla Category:Audio podcasts Category:Technology podcasts Category:Webby Award winners Category:Creative Commons-licensed podcasts Category:2017 podcast debuts
